res: Let $u_n$ denote the function $u_n(x) = -n$ if $x \leq -n$, $x$ if $-n < x \leq n$, and $n$ otherwise. Let $F$ be a function on the reals. Show that $F$ is continuous if and only if $u_n \circ F$ is continuous for all natural numbers $n$.

Translating: Let $u_n$ denote the function $u_n(x) = -n$ if $x \leq -n$, $x$ if $-n < x \leq n$, and $n$ otherwise. Let $F$ be a function on the reals. Show that $F$ is continuous if and only if $u_n \circ F$ is continuous for all natural numbers $n$.

res.content: You are a Mathematics, Lean 4 and coding assistant who answers questions about Mathematics and Lean 4, gives hints while coding in Lean 4. You also translates from natural language to Lean Theorem Prover code and vice versa when asked. Follow EXACTLY any examples given when generating Lean code.

Translate the following statement into Lean 4:
## Definition: A function is `n` times continuously differentiable in a set of a manifold if it is continuous
and, for any pair of points, it is `n` times continuously differentiable on this set in the charts
around these points. 

Give ONLY the Lean code

{ùïú : Type u_1} ‚Üí
  [inst : NontriviallyNormedField ùïú] ‚Üí
    {E : Type u_2} ‚Üí
      [inst_1 : NormedAddCommGroup E] ‚Üí
        [inst_2 : NormedSpace ùïú E] ‚Üí
          {H : Type u_3} ‚Üí
            [inst_3 : TopologicalSpace H] ‚Üí
              ModelWithCorners ùïú E H ‚Üí
                {M : Type u_4} ‚Üí
                  [inst_4 : TopologicalSpace M] ‚Üí
                    [inst_5 : ChartedSpace H M] ‚Üí
                      {E' : Type u_5} ‚Üí
                        [inst_6 : NormedAddCommGroup E'] ‚Üí
                          [inst_7 : NormedSpace ùïú E'] ‚Üí
                            {H' : Type u_6} ‚Üí
                              [inst_8 : TopologicalSpace H'] ‚Üí
                                ModelWithCorners ùïú E' H' ‚Üí
                                  {M' : Type u_7} ‚Üí
                                    [inst : TopologicalSpace M'] ‚Üí
                                      [inst : ChartedSpace H' M'] ‚Üí ‚Ñï‚àû ‚Üí (M ‚Üí M') ‚Üí Set M ‚Üí Prop

Translate the following statement into Lean 4:
## Theorem: A function which can be uniformly approximated by continuous functions is continuous. 

Give ONLY the Lean code

‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} {Œ≤ : Type v} [inst : UniformSpace Œ≤] {f : Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤} [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace Œ±],
  (‚àÄ u ‚àà uniformity Œ≤, ‚àÉ F, Continuous F ‚àß ‚àÄ (y : Œ±), (f y, F y) ‚àà u) ‚Üí Continuous f

Translate the following statement into Lean 4:
## Theorem: A function `f` on `Fin (n + 1)` is strictly monotone if and only if `f i < f (i + 1)`
for all `i`. 

Give ONLY the Lean code

‚àÄ {n : ‚Ñï} {Œ± : Type u_1} [inst : Preorder Œ±] {f : Fin (n + 1) ‚Üí Œ±},
  StrictMono f ‚Üî ‚àÄ (i : Fin n), f (Fin.castSucc i) < f (Fin.succ i)

Translate the following statement into Lean 4:
## Theorem: A uniform limit of continuous functions is continuous. 

Give ONLY the Lean code

Translate the following statement into Lean 4:
## Theorem:  Given a locally integrable function $f$ on the second countable topological space $X$ and a cover $(u\_n)$ of $X$ by open sets, there exists a sequence of integers $(n\_i)$ such that the function $f$ is integrable on $u\_ {n\_i} \cap X$.

Give ONLY the Lean code

‚àÄ {X : Type u_1} {E : Type u_3} [inst : MeasurableSpace X] [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace X] [inst_2 : NormedAddCommGroup E]
  {f : X ‚Üí E} {Œº : MeasureTheory.Measure X} {s : Set X} [inst_3 : SecondCountableTopology X],
  MeasureTheory.LocallyIntegrableOn f s Œº ‚Üí
    ‚àÉ u, (‚àÄ (n : ‚Ñï), IsOpen (u n)) ‚àß s ‚äÜ ‚ãÉ n, u n ‚àß ‚àÄ (n : ‚Ñï), MeasureTheory.IntegrableOn f (u n ‚à© s) Œº

Translate the following statement into Lean 4:
## Theorem: A continuous function is bounded above on a compact set. 

Give ONLY the Lean code

‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_2} {Œ≤ : Type u_3} [inst : LinearOrder Œ±] [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace Œ±] [inst_2 : TopologicalSpace Œ≤]
  [inst_3 : ClosedIciTopology Œ±] [inst_4 : Nonempty Œ±] {f : Œ≤ ‚Üí Œ±} {K : Set Œ≤},
  IsCompact K ‚Üí ContinuousOn f K ‚Üí BddAbove (f '' K)

Translate the following statement into Lean 4:
## Theorem: The theorem states that if a function `f` (from a linearly ordered topological space to another) is strictly increasing on a left neighborhood `s` of a point `a`, and every value less than `f(a)` is achieved by `f` on `s`, then `f` is continuous on the left of `a`. In other words, if you have a function that is strictly increasing in a neighborhood to the left of a certain point, and that function hits every value less than the function's value at that point within that neighborhood, then you can be sure that the function is left-continuous at that point.

Give ONLY the Lean code

‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} {Œ≤ : Type u_2} [inst : LinearOrder Œ±] [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace Œ±] [inst_2 : OrderTopology Œ±]
  [inst_3 : LinearOrder Œ≤] [inst_4 : TopologicalSpace Œ≤] [inst_5 : OrderTopology Œ≤] {f : Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤} {s : Set Œ±} {a : Œ±},
  StrictMonoOn f s ‚Üí s ‚àà nhdsWithin a (Set.Iic a) ‚Üí Set.SurjOn f s (Set.Iio (f a)) ‚Üí ContinuousWithinAt f (Set.Iic a) a

Translate the following statement into Lean 4:
## Theorem:  A function between two normed spaces is continuously differentiable within a set to degree (n+1) if and only if there exists a smaller set where every element has a Fr√©chet derivative and the derivative function is continuously differentiable to degree n.

Give ONLY the Lean code

‚àÄ {ùïú : Type u} [inst : NontriviallyNormedField ùïú] {E : Type uE} [inst_1 : NormedAddCommGroup E]
  [inst_2 : NormedSpace ùïú E] {F : Type uF} [inst_3 : NormedAddCommGroup F] [inst_4 : NormedSpace ùïú F] {s : Set E}
  {f : E ‚Üí F} {x : E} {n : ‚Ñï},
  ContDiffWithinAt ùïú (‚Üë(n + 1)) f s x ‚Üî
    ‚àÉ u ‚àà nhdsWithin x (insert x s), ‚àÉ f', (‚àÄ x ‚àà u, HasFDerivWithinAt f (f' x) u x) ‚àß ContDiffWithinAt ùïú (‚Üën) f' u x

Translate the following statement into Lean 4:
## Theorem: If a function is `C^n` with `n ‚â• 1`, then it is differentiable. 

Give ONLY the Lean code

Translate the following statement into Lean 4:
## Theorem:  If a real-valued function `f` is continuous and has strictly negative second derivative on the real numbers, then it is strictly concave on the set of all real numbers.

Give ONLY the Lean code
‚àÄ {f : ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù}, Continuous f ‚Üí (‚àÄ (x : ‚Ñù), deriv^[2] f x < 0) ‚Üí StrictConcaveOn ‚Ñù Set.univ f

Translate the following statement into Lean 4:
## Theorem: This theorem states that if a function `f` from `E` to `F` is `C^n` differentiable (notated as `ContDiff ùïú n f`), where `n` is a natural number or infinity (`‚Ñï‚àû`), `E` and `F` are normed add-commutative groups over a nontrivially normed field `ùïú`, then the negative of this function (defined as `fun x => -f x`) is also `C^n` differentiable. Essentially, it's asserting that the property of being `C^n` differentiable is preserved under taking the negative of a function.

Give ONLY the Lean code

Translate the following statement into Lean 4:
## Theorem:  A function `f : E ‚Üí F` between normed vector spaces is continuously differentiable at `x` to order `n + 1` if and only if there exists a continuously differentiable function `f' : E ‚Üí F` and a neighborhood `u` of `x` such that `f'` is the `(n + 1)`-th derivative of `f` on `u`.

Give ONLY the Lean code

‚àÄ {ùïú : Type u} [inst : NontriviallyNormedField ùïú] {E : Type uE} [inst_1 : NormedAddCommGroup E]
  [inst_2 : NormedSpace ùïú E] {F : Type uF} [inst_3 : NormedAddCommGroup F] [inst_4 : NormedSpace ùïú F] {f : E ‚Üí F}
  {x : E} {n : ‚Ñï},
  ContDiffAt ùïú (‚Üë(n + 1)) f x ‚Üî ‚àÉ f', (‚àÉ u ‚àà nhds x, ‚àÄ x ‚àà u, HasFDerivAt f (f' x) x) ‚àß ContDiffAt ùïú (‚Üën) f' x

Translate the following statement into Lean 4:
## Theorem: A function `f` on `Fin (n + 1)` is monotone if and only if `f i ‚â§ f (i + 1)` for all `i`. 

Give ONLY the Lean code

‚àÄ {n : ‚Ñï} {Œ± : Type u_1} [inst : Preorder Œ±] {f : Fin (n + 1) ‚Üí Œ±},
  Monotone f ‚Üî ‚àÄ (i : Fin n), f (Fin.castSucc i) ‚â§ f (Fin.succ i)

Translate the following statement into Lean 4:
## Theorem:  If `f : E ‚Üí F ‚Üí G` is a continuously differentiable n-times function between two normed add commutative groups with `g : E ‚Üí F` being continuous, then the function `x mapsto fderiv (ùïú) (fx) (gx)` is continuous, where `ùïú` is a nontrivially normed field.

Give ONLY the Lean code

‚àÄ {ùïú : Type u_1} [inst : NontriviallyNormedField ùïú] {E : Type uE} [inst_1 : NormedAddCommGroup E]
  [inst_2 : NormedSpace ùïú E] {F : Type uF} [inst_3 : NormedAddCommGroup F] [inst_4 : NormedSpace ùïú F] {G : Type uG}
  [inst_5 : NormedAddCommGroup G] [inst_6 : NormedSpace ùïú G] {f : E ‚Üí F ‚Üí G} {g : E ‚Üí F} {n : ‚Ñï‚àû},
  ContDiff ùïú n (Function.uncurry f) ‚Üí Continuous g ‚Üí 1 ‚â§ n ‚Üí Continuous fun x => fderiv ùïú (f x) (g x)

Translate the following statement into Lean 4:
## Theorem:  If a function is continuously differentiable on a set up to order n, then the negative of the function is also continuously differentiable on that set up to order n.

Give ONLY the Lean code

Translate the following statement into Lean 4:
## Theorem: A continuous function is bounded below on a compact set. 

Give ONLY the Lean code

‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_2} {Œ≤ : Type u_3} [inst : LinearOrder Œ±] [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace Œ±] [inst_2 : TopologicalSpace Œ≤]
  [inst_3 : ClosedIicTopology Œ±] [inst_4 : Nonempty Œ±] {f : Œ≤ ‚Üí Œ±} {K : Set Œ≤},
  IsCompact K ‚Üí ContinuousOn f K ‚Üí BddBelow (f '' K)
